intro: Cyrtandra ramosii, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Cyrtandra ramosii is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils.
